ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all, I support Kenâ€™s suggestion to move to Google Groups and broaden the name of the group. I also agree that Facebook has proved to be less than ideal

Subject: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

Hello all,

I support Ken=E2=80=99s suggestion to move to Google Groups and=
 broaden the name of the group.

I also agree that Facebook has proved to b=
e less than ideal because not everyone automatically receives an email/noti=
fication, since that is up to Facebook=E2=80=99s internal algorithms. I wou=
ld prefer a group where everyone gets each email if that is their preferenc=
e, which is not possible to my knowledge on Facebook. 

Best Regards,
Jeff =
Clune




> On Oct 20, 2019, at 11:52 PM, kstanley@... [neat] <ne=
at@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi all, it's an unfortunate development and=
 there doesn't seem to be an ideal resolution, but I would suggest we consi=
der moving to Google Groups.  I hear some skepticism on Google Groups' own =
staying power, but I think they are not going anywhere because (I believe) =
many companies use Google Groups internally.  In effect, Google Groups is a=
 part of a service that Google provides commercial users, so I think there'=
s a good chance of it being maintained seriously.  I find Google Groups is =
also well maintained and functional.
> 
> 
> One other reason to move to Go=
ogle might be that so many people use Gmail and other Google tools that joi=
ning a Google group would feel natural and easy for a new user, whereas joi=
ning a Yahoo group is becoming anachronistic, and thereby potentially inhib=
iting the growth of this discussion community. Of course, we do likely pay =
up front by losing some legacy of users, but over time that loss should be =
overcome.
> 
> By the way, Jeff Clune also started a Facebook group called =
Evolving Artificial Intelligence & Complexity (which you may also want to j=
oin), but I am not very happy with the venue there either because it doesn'=
t automatically send group messages to people's feeds, meaning that many po=
sts are not seen by the vast majority of the group's subscribers!  A year o=
r two ago, I noticed a change where posts started getting far fewer views e=
ven though the group membership had not decreased, so I don't trust how Fac=
ebook runs its groups very much.
> 
> If we do try to move to Google Groups=
, should we name the group something more broad, like Neuroevolution Discus=
sion Group?  It could reflect that the discussion in the group has broadene=
d over time.  
> 
> I think such a move could reinvigorate the group over t=
ime in part by dissociating it from what might be perceived as a diminishin=
g brand (Yahoo Groups).  It is unfortunate to have the topic (NEAT/neuroevo=
lution) conflated with the health of Yahoo Groups itself, as they really ha=
ve nothing to do with each other.
> 
> Best,
> 
> ken
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_FBE1A6D3-BE77-42A4-A2A5-6E4AC936C6DD
